sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects instances of svchost.exe running with an unusual or uncommon command line parameter by excluding known legitimate or common patterns.
This could point at a file masquerading as svchost, a process injection, or hollowing of a legitimate svchost instance.

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=%WINDIR%\system32\svchost.exe; Image=C:\Windows\system32\svchost.exe; EventID=1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
When C# is compiled dynamically, a .cmdline file will be created as a part of the process.
Certain processes are not typically observed compiling C# code, but can do so without touching disk.
This can be used to unpack a payload for execution

match_context.values: @{Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; TargetFilename=C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\raqcbc55\raqcbc55.cmdline; EventID=11}
@{TargetFilename=C:\Users\user\AppData\Local\Temp\4s3poj1r.cmdline}
@{TargetFilename=%TEMP%\ddwpvljx\ddwpvljx.cmdline}
@{TargetFilename=%TEMP%\nug2djqg\nug2djqg.cmdline}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Get the processes that are running on the local computer.

attributes.magic: DOS batch file, ASCII text, with very long lines (51718u), with CRLF line terminators

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factor was that it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects base64 encoded Powershell directives.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs
